meanings.definition: Gradually reduce or write off the cost or value of an asset over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: I will amortise the loan by making small payments each month.
meanings.sent2: Businesses often amortise the cost of equipment to manage expenses.
meanings.sent3: The accountant joked that he could amortise the company's losses by selling paperweights.
meanings.sent4: She decided to amortise her stress by taking short breaks throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The artist used colors to amortise the intensity of the painting.

meanings.definition: Pay off a debt with regular payments.
meanings.sent1: To become debt-free, she planned to amortise her credit card balance.
meanings.sent2: Many people choose to amortise their mortgages to avoid financial strain.
meanings.sent3: The student found a creative way to amortise his lunch debt by selling homemade cookies.
meanings.sent4: He felt a sense of relief as he started to amortise his financial burdens.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to amortise the school's outstanding debts.
